title: Coinbase Acquires Opyn Leadership Team for Derivatives Expansion
summary: Coinbase has acquired the leadership team from crypto derivatives protocol Opyn, including CEO Andrew Leone and Head of Research Joe Clark, to strengthen its derivatives offerings. The deal only includes the team members, not Opyn's actual protocol or products.

title: Tether to Discontinue USDT Support on Five Blockchains
summary: Tether will sunset USDT support on Algorand, Bitcoin Cash, EOS, Kusama, and Omni starting September 1. This represents a significant reduction in blockchain support for one of the largest stablecoins by market cap.

title: SharpLink Gaming Purchases 10,000 ETH for $25.7M
summary: Nasdaq-listed SharpLink Gaming (SBET) acquired 10,000 ETH from the Ethereum Foundation in an OTC deal at $2,572.37 per ETH. This brings their total holdings to approximately 215,634 ETH, making them the second largest ETH treasury holder.

title: Ethereum Foundation Plans zkEVM Integration for Base Layer
summary: The Ethereum Foundation announced a 1-year plan to integrate zero-knowledge proofs into Ethereum's base layer through an optional zkEVM client. The initiative targets sub-10 second latency and could eventually enable native zk rollups if proven reliable.

title: Smarter Web Company Adds 275 BTC to Treasury
summary: UK web design firm Smarter Web Company purchased an additional 275 BTC for £21.88M, bringing its total Bitcoin holdings to 1,275 BTC. This represents another corporate treasury adopting Bitcoin as a reserve asset.

title: Agora Raises $50M Series A for Custom Stablecoin Platform
summary: Stablecoin platform Agora raised $50M in Series A funding led by Paradigm, bringing total funding to $62M. Agora enables businesses to create custom stablecoins backed by its dollar-pegged AUSD with features like zero-fee minting and institutional-grade asset management.

title: KULR Technology Purchases 90 BTC, Total Holdings Reach 1,021 BTC
summary: NYSE-listed KULR Technology Group added 90 BTC for $10M to its treasury, bringing total holdings to 1,021 BTC valued at $113M. The purchase was funded through surplus cash, a $300M equity program, and a $20M Coinbase Credit facility.

title: K-Wave Media Secures $1B Funding for Bitcoin Treasury Strategy
summary: Nasdaq-listed K-pop media company K-Wave Media secured $1B in funding including a $500M convertible note deal with Anson Funds and $500M equity agreement with Bitcoin Strategic Reserve. They've acquired 88 BTC and plan to issue $15M in convertible notes with 80% allocated to Bitcoin purchases.

title: Monad Acquires Portal for Stablecoin Payment Infrastructure
summary: Monad has acquired Portal, a crypto payments infrastructure firm supporting 100+ blockchains, to bring full-stack stablecoin payment solutions to its ecosystem. Portal CEO Raj Parekh will join Monad Foundation as Head of Payments and Stablecoins.

title: Circle Partners with OKX to Expand USDC Liquidity
summary: Circle has partnered with OKX to expand USDC liquidity across blockchains, providing OKX's 60 million+ users direct 1:1 USD to USDC on/off ramp capabilities. This significantly expands USDC's accessibility and trading options across multiple chains.

title: Ripple Partners with BNY Mellon for RLUSD Custody
summary: Ripple has partnered with $52T AUM BNY Mellon to custody the US dollar and Treasury reserves backing its stablecoin RLUSD. RLUSD has reached $500M market cap within 7 months of launch, marking significant institutional adoption.

title: Eigen Labs Cuts 25% of Staff, Pivots to EigenCloud
summary: Eigen Labs has laid off approximately 25% of its workforce as it shifts focus to EigenCloud, described as the 'AWS of crypto'. EigenCloud integrates data availability (EigenDA), execution (EigenCompute), and verification (EigenVerify) into a single programmable verifiable cloud platform.

title: Remixpoint Raises $215M for Bitcoin Treasury Purchase
summary: Tokyo-listed energy firm Remixpoint Inc raised ¥31.5 billion ($215 million) with plans to use the full amount to purchase Bitcoin for its corporate treasury. This represents another significant corporate Bitcoin adoption from a traditional energy company.

title: Grayscale Replaces Polkadot with Hedera in Smart Contract Fund
summary: Grayscale removed Polkadot (DOT) from its Smart Contract Platform Ex-Ethereum Fund (GSCPxE) and replaced it with Hedera (HBAR) during quarterly rebalancing. This reflects changing institutional sentiment toward these layer-1 protocols.
